title: No Problem At All
content:
Just keep on doing what it is that you are doing.

I am rather old. I picked up Mozilla when it was on X 10. I do not have a complaint. Only dark mode. I had cataract surgeries, the plastic lenses now have cataracts too. Really! The WHITE screen is painful.

But, Firefox seems to work, and it works well. It is well organized, methodical, nothing to complain about. Yes, I am recognizing the spell checker. Yes, I am ranting. Yes, I am done!

Thank you!
creator: first.sheemon

title: New tab  "+" missing from tab bar with with 20 tabs or more
content: After the latest update (117.0 64-bit) I now do not see the '+' sign in the tab bar. Close them and it reappears, etc. Now for the fun bit: starting from scratch with a new window - the '+' is there, but open 20 more tabs and it goes.

title: I promise I am NOT a Brute
content:
I cannot log into a particular website when I use Firefox. I know it is on GoDaddy Server and they use wordpress.

I put in my id/pwd and get this

Your IP: xxxxxxxx URL: xxxxxxx.org/login/ Your Browser: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/117.0 Block ID: BBOT66 Block reason: Brute force bot was blocked. Time: 2023-08-31 23:44:30 Server ID: 11015

I clear my cache and even reboot my computer but still can't get in. I have no problems when I use Safari. Is there a setting I need to change in Firefox? Did I forget the double secret probation workaround?
creator: RyqWA

title: Double scrolling since v117.0
content: Since v117 update I noticed pages scroll way more. With one scroll they do double the amount of lines then previously. I thought I was seeing things, so I reinstalled Firefox v116.0 to make sure and confirmed it was scrolling less with the previous version. I found a setting "mousewheel.system_scroll_override.enabled" set to 'true' by default. Switching to 'false' fixes the scroll amount, but when I was back on v116.0 I checked that setting there and it was also set to 'true' by default, yet no double scrolling. So I have no idea what could cause this issue. Maybe something was 'fixed' with this setting and now it's applied correctly? Or should nothing change with scroll amount when updating from 116 to 117?
creator: guniu

title: I keep experiencing outages when there are none in my area-just my home.
content: For many months I keep having outages just in my home. There may be a week of perfect service and then a week of no internet, no TV, no service at all. I got a notice that everything was fixed at the end of last week. Everything was good and then there has been no service all this week. I am using my cell phone as a means of accessing the internet. This needs to be resolved for me. I have talked to support staff and have unplugged and plugged back in my wire to my modem. I have tried everything I know to do. There is something very, very wrong.
